title: Automation Rules
description: Create intelligent automation rules to handle repetitive GST litigation tasks automatically and ensure no critical deadlines are missed.

buttons.name: New Rule
buttons.purpose: Create a new automation rule with custom triggers and actions for specific GST scenarios
buttons.gstExample: Auto-create hearing preparation tasks when GST assessment order is uploaded to ensure 30-day appeal deadline compliance

buttons.name: Enable/Disable Toggle
buttons.purpose: Activate or deactivate automation rules based on current requirements or seasonal changes
buttons.gstExample: Disable automated hearing reminders during court vacation periods but keep assessment deadline tracking active

buttons.name: View Logs
buttons.purpose: Monitor automation rule execution history and troubleshoot any issues with rule performance
buttons.gstExample: Verify that GST deadline reminder emails were sent successfully to clients before statutory deadlines

buttons.name: Edit Rule
buttons.purpose: Modify existing automation rules to adapt to changing GST regulations or practice requirements
buttons.gstExample: Update appeal filing task template when GST appeal process changes require additional documentation

buttons.name: Test Rule
buttons.purpose: Simulate automation rule execution to verify correct behavior before activating in live environment
buttons.gstExample: Test GST audit response automation with sample data to ensure all required tasks are created properly

philosophy: Automation in GST litigation is not just convenienceâ€”it's essential risk management. GST cases involve strict statutory timelines (30-day appeal windows, 60-day refund claim responses) where missing deadlines can result in significant financial penalties for clients and potential malpractice exposure for practitioners. Our automation ensures systematic compliance with all GST procedural requirements.

examples.solution: Automation rule triggers: (1) Creates appeal filing task with 30-day deadline, (2) Generates client notification with case summary, (3) Schedules document collection tasks, (4) Sets up timeline reminders at 7, 14, and 21 days
examples.benefit: Zero missed appeal deadlines, improved client communication, systematic case preparation, reduced practice liability

examples.solution: Automation creates: (1) Hearing preparation checklist, (2) Document compilation task, (3) Client meeting scheduling, (4) Advocate brief preparation, (5) Travel arrangement reminders
examples.benefit: Comprehensive hearing preparation, no last-minute scrambling, professional client service, improved case outcomes

examples.solution: Automated follow-up sequence: (1) 60-day status check task, (2) 90-day escalation review, (3) 180-day legal notice preparation, (4) Client progress updates at each milestone
examples.benefit: Proactive refund tracking, improved recovery rates, systematic client communication, competitive advantage

examples.solution: Automation triggers: (1) Audit response preparation tasks, (2) Document compilation checklist, (3) Client conference scheduling, (4) Deadline tracking for all submission requirements
examples.benefit: Organized audit response, complete documentation, timely compliance, reduced audit penalties

examples.solution: Monthly automation: (1) Reviews upcoming GST return deadlines, (2) Creates client reminder tasks, (3) Generates compliance checklists, (4) Schedules review meetings
examples.benefit: Proactive compliance management, reduced penalty exposure, improved client relationships, practice differentiation

bestPractices.title: Start Simple
bestPractices.description: Begin with basic deadline tracking rules before implementing complex workflow automation
bestPractices.gstApplication: Start with GST appeal deadline tracking before automating entire case workflows

bestPractices.title: Test Thoroughly
bestPractices.description: Always test automation rules with sample data before deploying in live cases
bestPractices.gstApplication: Test GST automation with closed cases to verify all required tasks are generated correctly

bestPractices.title: Monitor Performance
bestPractices.description: Regularly review automation logs to ensure rules are working as expected
bestPractices.gstApplication: Weekly review of GST deadline automation to catch any missed notifications or task creation failures

bestPractices.title: Keep Rules Updated
bestPractices.description: Update automation rules when regulations or internal processes change
bestPractices.gstApplication: Update GST automation when appeal procedures change or new compliance requirements are introduced

troubleshooting.solution: Check trigger conditions and ensure all required fields are populated in the case data
troubleshooting.gstContext: Verify GST case type and stage fields are correctly set for automation triggers

troubleshooting.solution: Review date calculation logic in rule configuration and adjust for business days/holidays
troubleshooting.gstContext: Ensure GST deadline calculations account for court holidays and weekend exclusions

troubleshooting.solution: Check for multiple rules with similar triggers and implement task deduplication logic
troubleshooting.gstContext: Prevent duplicate GST hearing preparation tasks when multiple automation rules trigger simultaneously
